definition: Mechanical systems using toothed wheels to transmit and modify rotational motion, force, and speed.

positive_examples: The car's transmission uses a complex gear system to change speeds.
The bicycle's gear mechanism allows easier pedaling uphill.
The clock's internal gears keep precise time through regulated motion.
The wind turbine's gearbox increases the rotor's slow rotation for electricity generation.
The drill's gear train provides the torque needed for heavy-duty work.
The conveyor system relies on gear assemblies to move products smoothly.
negative_examples: The pulley system uses belts instead of gears to transfer power.
The hydraulic press operates using fluid pressure rather than gears.
The electric motor spins without any gear mechanisms.
The simple lever amplifies force through mechanical advantage alone.
The chain drive connects the bicycle pedals to the rear wheel.
The friction wheel transmits motion through surface contact.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Motors, Engines, Pumps, Levers, Pulleys
